conbody.p: Primary data are data faithfully extracted from text, and that are marking up with a type of attributes tob be parsed with R — this first step is essential for counting the performance of acting per (animated) entity.

p.note:
Preliminary step before introducing attributes values for Primary data: list of the animated entities (characters, attribute's value #entity) within the XML-TEI element listPerson:
XPath: /teiCorpus/TEI[1]/teiHeader[1]/profileDesc[1]/particDesc[1]
XML-TEI elements within TEI|teiHeader: profileDesc|particDesc|listPerson|person|persName
XML-TEI attributes: type|ana|xml:id
Values: entity|ID ENTITY|ENTITY'S NAME
Current research in the Cycle of Baʿlu and ʿAnatu by alphabtetic order: ʿAnatu (ANT), ʾAṯiratu, (ATH), ʾAṯtartu (ATT), Baʿlu (BAL), ʾIlu (ILU), Koṯaru (KOT), Baʿlu's messengers (MES_B), ʾIlu's messengers (MES_I), Yammu's messenger (MES_Y)s, Môtu (MOT), Šapsu (SAP), Yammu (YAM), warrior(s) (WAR), unknown (UNK).
XML-TEI example for ʿAnatu, attributes within the elements profileDesc ➞ particDesc ➞ listPerson elements before the XML-TEI attributes for xml:id entity and verb: <profileDesc><particDesc> <listPerson type="mythological" ana="#entity"> <person xml:id="ANT"><persName>ʾAnatu</persName></person> </listPerson> </particDesc></profileDesc>

conbody.p: Primary data within the elements encodingDesc ➞ classDecl:

ul.li:
Verb:
➯ Most relevant lexem in a group of words or a sentence. A verb belongs to a taxonomy (= category) and sub-taxonomy (objective variables).
XML-TEI:<taxonomy xml:id="primaryData"> <category xml:id="verb"/> </taxonomy>

Animated entity:
➯ who is the character acting in several ways with relevant objective and subjective variables.
XML-TEI attribute for Primary data animated entity: <taxonomy xml:id="primaryData"> <category xml:id="entity"/> </taxonomy>
